H0.text: The roots turning downward is how sprouting plants exhibit positive gravitropism.

H1.text: The roots move horizontally is the way sprouting plants exhibit positive gravitropism.

H2.text: The leaves face toward the Sun when sprouting plants exhibit positive gravitropism.

H3.text: The stems curl around supports is the way sprouting plants exhibit positive gravitropism.

A4.text: roots grow in the direction of gravitational pull (i.e., downward).

A5.text: In roots, this results in the inhibition of cell expansion on the lower side and the concomitant curvature of the roots towards gravity (positive gravitropism).
